items.content_html: I have grown to like having my daughter sitting at the same table as me for her remote lessons, except when she updates me every 5 seconds about how utterly painful her drawn-out Zoom classes are. I definitely feel for her though.

items.content_html: My weekend has become all about geeking out with Obsidian, Roam Research and methodologies for creating dynamically linked personal knowledgebases. 😍 📝
items.content_text: My weekend has become all about geeking out with [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md), [Roam Research](https://roamresearch.com) and methodologies for creating dynamically linked personal knowledgebases. 😍 📝

items.content_html: TIL today: It’s possible to add emoji to Micro.blog using Unicode for emoji (at least in Custom CSS). I was customising my blog’s Custom CSS, and couldn’t seem to add emoji directly. @manton pointed me in the right direction, and something like this works: content: "U+1F4AC";
items.content_text: TIL today: It's possible to add emoji to Micro.blog using Unicode for emoji (at least in Custom CSS). I was customising my blog's Custom CSS, and couldn't seem to add emoji directly. [@manton](https://micro.blog/manton) pointed me in the right direction, and something like this works: `content: "U+1F4AC";`

items.content_html: I really like the Obsidian text editor. The new Obsidian Publish is really interesting. As the team adds features like custom domain and CSS support, it could become a super lightweight static site publishing option too. 🤔
items.content_text: I really like the Obsidian text editor. The new [Obsidian Publish](https://publish.obsidian.md/help/Add-on+services/Obsidian+Publish) is really interesting. As the team adds features like custom domain and CSS support, it could become a super lightweight static site publishing option too. 🤔

items.content_html: I’m curious how many people have switched to services like Micro.blog from WordPress as a result of the move towards the block editor as the primary editor in WordPress. 🤔

items.content_html: 💡 If you play D&D, or another TTRPG, and you’re looking for inspiration for adventure locations, there are a number of terrific resources. One of my favourites is Earth View from Google that has amazing satellite imagery from our incredible planet.
items.content_text: 💡 If you play D&D, or another TTRPG, and you're looking for inspiration for adventure locations, there are [a number](https://www.reddit.com/r/EarthPorn/) of [terrific resources](https://www.reddit.com/r/FantasyMaps/). One of my favourites is [Earth View from Google](https://earthview.withgoogle.com/) that has amazing satellite imagery from our incredible planet.

items.title: Revisiting Micro.blog (again)
items.content_html:
At the risk of making more silly, grand declarations about the utility of Internet services (which I’m probably prone to do), I’ve started taking another look at Micro.blog. Something about @Manton’s announcement about the v2 update caught my attention. The update is very nice, and my recent posts were really nicely cross-posted to Twitter.

That’s probably a bit of an arbitrary statement, although given how easy it is to publish a quick post to Micro.blog from my phone, I really like the idea of using my MB blog for quick status updates that share nicely to Twitter (FWIW).

I’m not ready to give up my WordPress sites (that’s not really the end goal here). At the same time, it’s easier to send out a quick update with Micro.blog, as much as the WordPress.com mobile app has grown over the years. One set of features in the v2.0 update that I really like are the Bookmarks and highlights features. The highlights feature, in particular, reminds me of how Instapaper handled/handles sharing highlights.

Anyway, just a quick, non-Grand_Declarations, FYI.
items.content_text:
At the risk of making more silly, grand declarations about the utility of Internet services (which [I'm probably prone to do](https://pauljacobson.me/2018/12/28/more-thoughts-about-micro-blog-as-an-indie-social-network/)), I've started taking another look at [Micro.blog](https://micro.blog/). Something about [@Manton](https://micro.blog/Manton)'s [announcement about the v2 update](https://www.manton.org/2020/09/29/whats-new-in.html) caught my attention. The update is very nice, and my recent posts were really nicely cross-posted to Twitter.

That's probably a bit of an arbitrary statement, although given how easy it is to publish a quick post to Micro.blog from my phone, I really like the idea of using my MB blog for quick status updates that share nicely to Twitter (FWIW).

I'm not ready to give up my WordPress sites (that's not really the end goal here). At the same time, it's easier to send out a quick update with Micro.blog, as much as the WordPress.com mobile app has grown over the years. One set of features in the v2.0 update that I really like are the [Bookmarks and highlights](https://news.micro.blog/2020/09/22/bookmarks-and-highlights.html) features. The highlights feature, in particular, reminds me of how Instapaper handled/handles sharing highlights.

Anyway, just a quick, non-Grand_Declarations, FYI.

items.content_html: Someone may have answered this question before, but here goes: Has anyone worked out how to import a Twitter archive into Micro.blog? This would be a pretty interesting thing to do (after disabling automatic posting to Twitter, of course). 🤔
items.content_text: Someone may have answered this question before, but here goes: Has anyone worked out how to import a Twitter archive into Micro.blog? This would be a pretty interesting thing to do (after disabling automatic posting to Twitter, of course). 🤔

items.content_html: I opened my blog this morning, and discovered a 500 Internal Server error. Turns out the IndieWeb plugin (v3.3.12) crashed my site. 😱 It looks like there’s a fix coming but, for now, my site feels pretty disconnected.
items.content_text: I opened my blog this morning, and discovered a `500 Internal Server error`. Turns out the IndieWeb plugin (v3.3.12) crashed my site. 😱 It looks like [there's a fix coming](https://github.com/indieweb/wordpress-indieweb/issues/127) but, for now, my site feels pretty disconnected.

items.content_html: Just messing around with MarsEdit integration. It’s such an awesome app that I just don’t appreciate nearly enough.

items.content_html:
Potentially silly question:

Given that my primary hub on the Web is my WordPress blog, where would a Micro.blog fit in, and be a meaningful adjunct to my main site?

Or is it better to consolidate, and figure out how to better use my main blog for shorter updates instead?
items.content_text:
Potentially silly question:

Given that my primary hub on the Web is my WordPress blog, where would a Micro.blog fit in, and be a meaningful adjunct to my main site?

Or is it better to consolidate, and figure out how to better use my main blog for shorter updates instead?
